intro: Pterocypsela elata, commonly known as the tall pterocypsela, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its structure features a tall, slender stem with alternate leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. The fruit is a dry, hairy achene, which is adapted for wind dispersal.
